simple.monitor.impl

Class ProgressableThreadImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.monitor.impl.ProgressableThreadImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Progressable, ProgressableThread

    public abstract class ProgressableThreadImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProgressableThread
    Simple implementation.
    Created: Jun 26, 2006
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

      • waitFor

        public int waitFor()
        Description copied from interface: ProgressableThread
        Blocks until the object finishes and returns an exit code.
        Specified by:
        waitFor in interface ProgressableThread
        Returns:
        An "exit value". Values and meanings depend on implementer. As a general rule, an exit value of 0 should mean that it finished normally.

      • getCurrentValue

        public int getCurrentValue()
        Description copied from interface: Progressable
        Returns the current value. This should not be below the minimum or above the maximum.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentValue in interface Progressable
        Returns:
        The current number for this object.

      • getMaximum

        public int getMaximum()
        Description copied from interface: Progressable
        Returns the number that needs to be reached in order to finish. This number can change over time.

      • getMinimum

        public int getMinimum()
        Description copied from interface: Progressable
        Returns the number to start at. This number may change over time, though it generally shouldn't.
